alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 12:49PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wyoming County through 115 PM EDT... At 1248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kasson Brook, or 9 miles southwest of Tunkhannock, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Tunkhannock, Noxen, Mehoopany, Forkston, Kasson Brook, Evans Falls, Beaumont, Eatonville and Center Moreland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
